newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Midco diesel basis steady in thin trade.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Midco diesel basis steady in thin trade.

text.p: U.S. Midcontinent diesel fuel and unleaded gasoline differentials were unchanged in thin trade on Tuesday, traders said.

Buyers that emerged in the Group Three market for late-January unleaded barrels on Monday seemed have retreated, but differentials held onto their gains as discussion turned quiet in the spot markets.
"We are really dead. The board is dead and the cash market is dead," one trader said.
Group Three low sulphur diesel for late-January deliveries was talked 2.50/2.25 cents a gallon under NYMEX February heating oil, and high sulphur was 6.25 cents a gallon under the print.
Chicago low sulphur diesel for February deliveries was talked 2.25/2.0 cents a gallon under NYMEX March heating oil, with high sulphur 3.0 cents a gallon under the print.
Prompt unleaded gasoline was bid 1.50 cents under NYMEX February unleaded in Group Three and 0.75 cent under NYMEX March unleaded in Chicago.
